text: ambulances rushing to the site of an
explosion the target quit his main
hospital many lawyers were among the
dead and injured they'd come to mourn a
colleague a prominent advocate and the
head of the Bar Association who was
gunned down earlier in the day they
stood outside the emergency ward to
protest his killing before they
themselves became victims of a blast
there were scenes of carnage and chaos
as emergency services rushed to move the
injured to safety the local bomb
disposal squad says that at least eight
kilos of explosives were used the police
suspect a suicide bombing inside the
hospital people scrambled for safety
amid utter fear and confusion outside
some were overwhelmed by the violence
that hit them police have surrounded the
hospital and cordoned off the area
an investigation is now underway to find
out how an attack on this scale
hit the heart of the main hospital of
the provincial capital Quetta has seen
many attacks in the past and lawyers
have been targeted in recent weeks but
this blast marks a new level of violence
against advocates in Pakistan's restive
province of Baluchistan
the provinces chief minister said this
was a security lapse and was quick to
blame Pakistan's regional rival India
lawyers across the country have
denounced the bombing and announced a
countrywide one-day strike and a week of
mourning shy mahalia BBC News Islamabad
